definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: I wish to congratulate Sahin for making his debut.
sentences.chinese: 我要祝賀沙欣完成了他的首秀。

sentences.english: He took his debut in his stride, didn't he?
sentences.chinese: 他把握住了首秀的機會，大跨步的前進，對吧？

sentences.english: An Under-21 game between England and Italy was the curtain-raiser at the revamped stadium.
sentences.chinese: 英格蘭和意大利的U21比賽成爲新球場的首秀。

definition: to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
